div.p: This page provides a list of the FHIR artifacts defined as part of this implementation guide.

{% capture grouping_desc %}These are profiles on resources or data types that describe patterns used by other profiles, but cannot be instantiated directly. I.e. instances can conform to profiles *based* on these abstract profiles, but do not declare conformance to the abstract profiles themselves.{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}A profile for the data elements required to identify an organization that manufactures, processes or tests drug products or substances.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A profile for the data elements required to identify the sponsor of the drug products or substances.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}A profile that represents the document or diagram in base64.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Batch or lot release testing to ensure that pharmaceutical products meet the product specification.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Listing of all components of the dosage form to be used in the manufacture, their amounts on a per batch basis, including overages, and reference to their quality standards.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Identifies the ingredients for the batch forumla{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

{% capture desc %}Any raw material intended for use int he manufacture of a drug substance, or any ingredient intended for use in the manufacture of a drug product including those that may not appear in such drug product.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Includes the properties of the drug product, its components and impurities{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The amount detais about the drug product compoents to define the product composition in a product unit.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The amount detais about the drug product ingredients in the batch.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Includes the properties of the drug product as manufactured.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Drug Substance (Active Ingredient) nomenclature and characterizaiton{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Any component of the drug substance that is not the chemical entity.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Includes the properties of the drug substance as manufactured.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Provides sufficient information to identify an inactive substance and its source.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Alternate structure present inf the drug substance{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A quality specificaion is for a drug product or drug substance (excipient, API or raw material.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Belgian profile for an observation in a laboratory report{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Includes the identfying information of the drug product{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Provides sufficient information to identify a drug substance.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}pq-specific Constraints on the Address datatype dealing with US addresses.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Any additional information{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The percentage of the component in the drug product.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}This profile defines the details of a batch of medicine.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A code that describes how to relate the given value to an acceptance value.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}Amount and rationale for excess drug substance.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The product specification used in the batch release or stability testing.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The quantity made by the batch formula.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}The percentage of the component in the batch.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A mathematical symbol that denotes equality or inequality between two values.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}A physical (contetn) of activity measurement of the strenght of the active ingredient.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
{% capture desc %}{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

div.p: {% capture grouping_desc %}These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide{% endcapture %} {{ grouping_desc | markdownify}}

tr.td: {% capture desc %}Classification of a sections of a PQ/CMC composition/document generally based on eCTD Module 3 section numbering for product and substance. A composition can have many section codes.{% endcapture %} {{ desc | markdownify}}
